content: When F is the identity map, then the theory of Artin gluing applies. In that case, it is enough for the functor G to preserve binary pullbacks. I'm not sure what happens for general F.
I think OP is asking for conditions on more general categories to produce a topos?
Yes: just to be ultra-explicit, Jon is implicitly assuming the categories are toposes, while Ellis was not.
Are there examples of interest where the categories involved are not topoi?
